data.meanings: To pass or pass by or pass beyond, proceed, go along or go through or go over, go away or pass away, to run or flow (namely water), go across a thing, come upon, overcome, make a thing bitter or displeasing, to drag a thing along, to twist or turn a thing in an attempt to throw it down, to go on in a continuous/constant manner or course, to be firm/resolute/determined/strong, firmly resist a thing, to murmur or grumble, to shake or quiver or quake, move to and fro or from side to side, to be in a state of commotion, overcome by bile.
data.sentence: The word مَرُّوا comes from the root م ر ر and is associated with the meanings: To pass or pass by or pass beyond, proceed, go along or go through or go over, go away or pass away, to run or flow (namely water), go across a thing, come upon, overcome, make a thing bitter or displeasing, to drag a thing along, to twist or turn a thing in an attempt to throw it down, to go on in a continuous/constant manner or course, to be firm/resolute/determined/strong, firmly resist a thing, to murmur or grumble, to shake or quiver or quake, move to and fro or from side to side, to be in a state of commotion, overcome by bile.

data.meanings: press, squeeze, made a sign with the eye, cattle of a bad quality, limping, halting, suspected of a fault
data.sentence: The word يَتَغَامَزُونَ comes from the root غ م ز and is associated with the meanings: press, squeeze, made a sign with the eye, cattle of a bad quality, limping, halting, suspected of a fault
